data.title: Rage Against the Machine
data.text:
Rage Against the Machine (often abbreviated as RATM and shortened to simply Rage) was an American rock band from Los Angeles, California. Formed in 1991, the group consists of vocalist Zack de la Rocha, bassist and backing vocalist Tim Commerford, guitarist Tom Morello, and drummer Brad Wilk. Their songs express revolutionary political views. As of 2010, they had sold over 16 million records worldwide.

Members

Tim Commerford - Bass, backing vocals

Zach de la Roche - Vocals

Tom Morello - Guitar

Brad Wilk - Drums, percussion

Why They and Their Songs Killed in the Name of Awesomeness

They pioneered rap and nu metal.

Their blend of rap, funk, and heavy metal is incredible, proving that their songs aren't just rock, funk, and heavy metal, but also rap as well, giving their songs a rap metal genre and sound; for example, "Guerrilla Radio" blends funk and rap metal, giving it a rap, funk metal sound.

Zack is an amazing vocalist and rapper.

Amazing flow on the majority of their songs.

They have never released a bad album or a bad song.

Tim is a great bassist.

Tom Morrello is an amazing guitarist; his use of effects makes his guitar sound like a DJ booth.

Brad is a great drummer.

Their songs address many things like war, immigration, capitalism, etc.

While filming their music video for "Sleep Now in the Fire" on Wall St., they caused such a ruckus that the Stock Market shut down in the middle of the day.

Discography

Rage Against the Machine (1992)

Evil Empire (1996)

The Battle of Los Angeles (1999)

Renegades (2000)

Trivia
